ref_criterion: Includes clear instructions on brushing teeth twice a day and flossing at least once a week.
gen_criterion: Provides a clear and concise explanation of the importance of regular dental check-ups and professional cleanings in preventing oral health issues.

ref_criterion: Advises using mouthwash regularly and the correct technique of gargling.
gen_criterion: Advises patient to maintain good oral hygiene habits and to visit a dentist for a professional cleaning and examination.

ref_criterion: Advises consulting a dentist to rule out a cavity as the user mentions a brown spot.

ref_criterion: Gives incorrect brushing instructions, such as brushing only for 30 seconds or brushing only at night.

ref_criterion: Suggests brushing twice a day (once in the morning and once before bed) for about 2 minutes each time using gentle circular motions, flossing once a day, and using mouthwash once a day for appropriate oral health.

ref_criterion: Suggests using a soft-bristled toothbrush, toothpaste containing fluoride, and alcohol-free mouthwash.

ref_criterion: Suggests rinsing mouth immediately after brushing. (Justification: Although it is a common practice to rinse mouth immediately after brushing, it is recommended to spit out the excess toothpaste and not rinse immediately as it will wash away the concentrated fluoride.)
gen_criterion: Advises patient to maintain good oral hygiene habits and to visit a dentist for a professional cleaning and examination.
